docs.lead_paragraph:
WEST POINT, N.Y. — It was two days before the start of a potentially fraught regular season for the Yankees, and still, baseball here felt beside the point.
 
The Yankees made the hourlong drive north from the city on Saturday to the idyllic grounds of the United States Military Academy to play an exhibition game against Army. In the 23rd meeting of the teams — the first one since 1976 — the Yankees won, 10-5.

docs.snippet: Maple syrup conjures images of old-fashioned rural New England, but the reality is changing with the help of technology....
docs.lead_paragraph: Maple syrup conjures images of old-fashioned rural New England, but the reality is changing with the help of technology.
docs.abstract: Maple syrup conjures up images of old-fashioned rural New England, but the reality is changing with the help of technologies that make sugaring more efficient and sanitary; United States maple syrup production hit new high in 2011, with 5.5 million tapped trees, up from 4 million in 2001; Canada produces more than 80 percent of world's maple syrup.

headline.seo: Maple Syrup Takes Turn Toward Technology
headline.main: High-Tech Means of Production Belies Nostalgic Image of Maple Syrup
headline.print_headline: High-Tech Means of Production Belies the Nostalgic Image of Maple Syrup
